meanings.definition: Moving in a twisting or wriggling motion
meanings.sent1: The snake looked even squirmier after shedding its skin.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar was squirmier than the inchworm.
meanings.sent3: The wiggly puppy became even squirmier when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The river took a squirmier path through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dance routine became squirmier as the music picked up speed.

meanings.definition: More uncomfortable or embarrassed than someone else
meanings.sent1: She felt squirmier than her friend during the awkward silence.
meanings.sent2: He appeared squirmier than the rest of the team during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes made the audience squirmier in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The hot weather made everyone squirmier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The embarrassing moment left her feeling squirmier than ever before.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to feel uncomfortable or embarrassed
meanings.sent1: The prank was squirmier than expected, leaving everyone red-faced.
meanings.sent2: The awkward situation became even squirmier with each passing minute.
meanings.sent3: The movie scene was intentionally made squirmier for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's question made the students squirmier in their seats.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected comment made the atmosphere squirmier in an instant.
